intro: Chamaesaracha edwardsiana, commonly known as the Edwards' chamaesaracha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, yellow to orange flowers during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
